sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: ROYSTON a town of Hertfordſhire in England, ſeated in E. Long. o. 1. N. Lat. 52. 3. It is a large place, ſeated in a fertile vale full of inns, and the market is very conſiderable for corn. There was lately diſcovered, almoſt under the market place, a ſubterra-neous chapel of one Roſia, a Saxon Lady : it has ſeveral altars and images cut out of the chalky ſides, and is in form of a ſugar-loaf, having no entrance but at the top.
